p: Infection with BVDV has severely damaged the cattle industry throughout Japan. Based on the results of the latest survey on PI animals on dairy farms in Japan, the prevalence of farms with PI animals is calculated as 7.6% (95% confidence interval [CI], 3.1–16.4%), and the prevalence of cattle tested as PI animals was 0.12% (95% CI, 0.05–0.25%) [ 17]. In addition, based on the investigation of BVDV epidemics from 2006 to 2014 in Hokkaido, where most dairy cattle are reared in Japan, BVDV-1b and BVDV-2a viruses were the predominant BVDV subgenotypes [ 1].
